availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W Shields (Pendleton County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, carpenter and farmer. Pendleton County, Kentucky native. Son of Samuel M. Shields. Married Harriet Ann Browning Shields in Brown County, Ohio, on June 12, 1851. Father of William T Shields, Nancy Shields, James H. Shields, Emma Shields and Mary Shields. Resident in Pendleton County in 1850. Carpenter in Pendleton County in 1860. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 354A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 446.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 2, p. 416A.
Ohio Marriage Records, Ohio Historical Society, Columbus, Ohio, Brown County Marriages, Film #000384274, p. 220.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Bracken, Pendleton, Harrison, Garret, Gallatin, Carroll, and Trimble County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 225 (Accessed via ancestry.com).
